alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:59AM EST until December 19 at 5:28PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maine... Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Franklin and Somerset Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Carrabassett River at North Anson. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Route 27 begins to flood north of Kingfield, along with Route 146 and 16 in New Portland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon, then crest around 21.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
